Posts.Content: No one told me either, it was just a chance remark I made that I found out. Eases the worry of finding money for two prescriptions a month. I'm on Tamoxifen/Zoladex for ten years and apparently can get an extension after five. You can get form from pharmacy too, but gp does need to sign it.
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: There is an excellent free book called Mummy's Lump that I used with my then nearly 2yo to prepare her for what was ahead and me going into hospital for a while, daddy and nana looking after her and then being careful and gentle with me after mastectomy and diep reconstruction. She now knows 'good boobie' and 'lumpy cancer boobie'. She knows it's better now and Mummy can lift and carry again. Good luck with your treatment.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: I'm t total and I got bc!
Posts.Title: Is there any link between alcohol consumption and breast cancer?

Posts.Content: I have my slb on 21.12, following a blue dye injection the day before.  How blue do you go btw? I want to know about recovery afterwards. Is it painful?  Can you lift?  Drive?  Can you move arm?  What are dos and don'ts please.
Posts.Title: After sentinel lymph node biopsy

Posts.Content: purplediva I've got mine next Tuesday (7th). My boobs are still quite tender which I didn't think they would be now as it's a year on Friday since my op. I can understand the left as that's the one that had all the treatment, but I expected the right one to be okay as it was done to match. I'm worried it will be painful, but agree it has to be done. I was told that they will not do a mammogram on my diep reconstructed boob.....is that incorrect?
Posts.Title: One Year On !!

Posts.Content: Think that covers me too. Thank you. I was wondering!
Posts.Title: So what am I?...

Posts.Content: I had my Mestek to me on 4th January with immediate Diep construction.  I also had my trains in for about 10 days at home, but was able to shower after three days. Magazines were good initially as I couldn't concentrate on a long book, until one night when I went straight through as was suffering complete insomnia! Also  iPhone and charger with the best things to keep in touch with people through WhatsApp and messaging and face time as visiting hours are limited and I was well over an hour away from home. Good luck with your surgery take it one day at a time. Each day things get better and now I feel good. I echo what was said about the arm exercises to as I had a full lymph node clearance. They are a bugger at first, but so worth it as my arm movement is practically back to where it was before. Persevere.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: I had my mastectomy diep reconstruction and node removal on 4.1.17. On Monday I start my phased return to work.  I'm so anxious it's ridiculous!  I will be doing three weeks of reduced hours, then it's half term, then full time.  As a teacher I've been planning lessons etc this week and it's put me in such a bad and low mood. I feel so pathetic as there is no reason now not to return, but I'm getting cauliwobbles over it.  Big time.  I'm hoping once I'm back I'll quickly get into the swing of things, but also know that back is back and I will not be given much leeway for being off.  How did you cope with returning?
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Dictation failed me ...   that should say mastectomy and drains!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: Hi Gay I think she cannot cut your hours and pay like that based on phased return hours. She has to treat you equally and you are protected by disability act and equality act forever. Macmillan advisor at hospital gave me two booklets. One for me and one for employers. Sorry I can't remember the names, but they were very useful. Someone else may know? Or look at publications on this site.
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. I guess I'll see how it goes tomorrow and take it from there. X
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Oh. Regarding the three weeks reduced... I was asked by my boss to try and be back full time after half term.    Originally she didn't want me to do any phased return, however I think she must have read or been told my rights as she did a rather rapid u turn!!  I didn't want to start back sooner so have myself to blame for the three weeks
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Great ideas ronstar. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Squeezing some good out of this nasty disease

Posts.Content: Brilliant news
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Had a mastectomy reconstruction and full node clearance a week ago today. Sneezed twice last night and thought I was splitting in two.  Still struggling to get out if bed now not in hospital bed.  Got one drain to go which could be out by Friday, it was 50mls yesterday. How was your surgery recovery?  Any top tips for feeling better?  Only things I did yesterday were showering and doing a 10 min walk. Then reading and sleeping. Getting fed up already!!!
Posts.Title: Recovery after mastectomy/diep

Posts.Content: Now 10 days post op. All drains out and feeling much brighter, but tire easily.  Dressings have been changed and wounds healing well.  Stomach very tight, but I'm now pretty much upright.  Next thing is the wait for biopsy results and further treatment.
Posts.Title: Recovery after mastectomy/diep

Posts.Content: I had six biopsys in my left breast. You get a local anaesthetic first. They told me what to expect and honestly they over played it. I didn't feel a thing while they did it.  When anaesthetic wore off it was like a mild bruise pain. Very manageable. Good luck. Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Woo hoo. Finished.
Posts.Title: I've finished all of the treatment!

Posts.Content: having mastectomy diep on 4.1. What shall I pack?  Been given a basic list, but is there anything you wish you had taken but didn't?
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much. These replies are great!
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Ive not heard of this either. When mine went in they scanned to check them.  Have you been allocated a breast care nurse you could call to discuss?  Or does your hospital have a walk in breast clinic you can go to for advice?
Posts.Title: Titanium marker

Posts.Content: I had surgery on 23rd December. Day before had the radioactive dye and ct scan.  On the day arrived at 7am. Was first one called, benefits of a latex allergy!  Saw anaesthetist, registrar and nurse. Was taken to surgery, then recovery.  You have to eat, drink and wee before you go home. I left at 2pm!  Very little pain as meds controlled it.  Stayed blue until my mastectomy on 4th January when it was cut out.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Sentinel Node surgery

Posts.Content: I'm on day 9 of first Tamoxifen. Period started two days ago. OMG the pain. It is soooo bad. Ibuprofen isn't touching it. Is this normal?  Starting Zolodex soon.
Posts.Title: First period after starting Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: if I am on Tamoxifen and Zolodex, do I need to use contraception?  I know I can't use the pill as its hormones and I'm er+, but if my ovaries are shut down and I'm in menopause, I'm assuming I can't get pregnant...?
Posts.Title: Contraception

Posts.Content: I'm in my first month of taking both.  I had a period near the beginning, but started bleeding again this morning.  Should I call my BCN on Monday?
Posts.Title: Bleeding on tamoxifen and Zolodex

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy with diep reconstruction in January. First two weeks were tough, but each subsequent week got easier. By 6 weeks I was feeling much better, but fatigue was an issue. Try and walk every day. It helps with building up stamina.
Posts.Title: Pain after mastectomy/implant reconstruction

Posts.Content: Before my diep I was asked if I'd had previous abdominal surgery. I haven't so didn't pursue it, but my feeling was if I had they couldn't do a diep.  Phone your bcn to put your mind at rest.
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Violet blue Good luck with your result, that is quick. Do you think you will need any further treatment? I do have a couple of question for you. Did you have any complications during/after surgery? How long did you stay in hospital for? And finally are you completely immobile at the moment or can you still do basic things? Kerry xx I had no complications during a nine hour surgery. Nursing care was outstanding.  I had my op on Wednesday and was home on Monday.  I was out of bed day two in a chair and day three started doing laps of the ward. I was told the more I move the quicker I'll heal.  Getting out of bed was painful to start with, but tell the nurses and they control your pain meds.  I refused morphine after day two as it made me feel so ill and coped mainly with paracetamol and ibuprofen. On two occasions I asked for something more and got tram afoul.  I'm doing my breast/arm exercises everyday and walked for half an hour yesterday, although that was exhausting and I came home for a nap!  There are things I'm not allowed to do like lift a kettle or carry my two year old.  I'm still getting meals prepared for me, enjoying being pampered!  The thing I found most difficult initially was getting out of bed.  I could lie down, but it took two weeks before I could get from horizontal to vertical.  My husband had to pull me up, but I can do it myself now! Good luck with your surgery. Any more questions, I'm happy to answer.  Stay positive, you will get a little better every day.
Posts.Title: Choosing a mastectomy

Posts.Content: I have my first Zoladex injection on Thursday and I'm worrying about how painful it will be because of my Diep reconstruction scars. ie I have no stomach fat left!  Will this make it more painful? How was it for you?
Posts.Title: Zoladex after diep

Posts.Content: Forgot to say having mastectomy diep.
Posts.Title: 5 days till surgery and starting to freak out...

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry, I'm getting my results tomorrow, 16 days after surgery, and seeing the oncologist for first time on Monday.  If you have any questions about the surgery fire away.
Posts.Title: Choosing a mastectomy

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy with diep reconstruction two weeks ago.  I did have time to think about it as was diagnosed at end of November and Christmas/New Year delayed operation. For me this was the only way to go.  I'm still sore and swollen, but getting better every day.
Posts.Title: Choosing a mastectomy

Posts.Content: AHad slb on 21.12. Felt fine, moved straight away. No pain. Didn't need pain killers etc. A week later and I have a tingling sensation from my scar to my elbow if I touch it. Anyone else had this?  Follow up appointment for results on 3rd January
Posts.Title: Strange pain after slb

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone. Today I'm in a lets get on with it mood. Too much thinking time is not good, do keeping busy.
Posts.Title: 5 days till surgery and starting to freak out...

Posts.Content: Five days til surgery and I'm starting to freak out First: Have never left lo overnight and now I have to do it for at least five. Will she feel abandoned even though DH and nana are with her and childminder routine in day?  Will she hate me when I return and can't lift, carry or have her on my lap for weeks?  Will it affect our bond? Second: I'm rubbish with pain.  How much agony am I going to go through mentally as well as physically? Aaaaaaaaaaaaaagggggggggghhhhhhhhh
Posts.Title: 5 days till surgery and starting to freak out...

Posts.Content: Thank you LondonLass for your reassuring reply.  My head understands but my heart is breaking at the thought of leaving her.
Posts.Title: 5 days till surgery and starting to freak out...

Posts.Content: The waiting is by far the worst thing. But agree with previous poster: you've found something and you are getting sorted. The sooner the better. Well done for getting it seen to.
Posts.Title: Breast clinic referral waiting game

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy, diep reconstruction and will need ten year tamoxifen and Zolodex. I've got four months off work and I can't lift or carry my toddler. But I don't need chemo. Apparently, some idiot just told me, my cancer wasn't that serious then.  So angry and upset I could have screamed and punched.
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy diep on 4.1.17. Hospital signed me off for two weeks. Gp then signed off for three months. Think this is a bit overkill a as recovery from surgery is apparently 6-8 weeks. However I work with five yr olds and don't know my next treatment stage for another two weeks so she was being cautious.  If you have any questions, fire away.
Posts.Title: DIEP or implant reconstruction

Posts.Content: got a letter in the post today. My first mammogram since mastectomy I'm January. A year since diagnosis. A bit freaked out. Do they do both boobs or just the one that hasn't been reconstructed?  I had skin sparing mastectomy with diep.
Posts.Title: Mama gram after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone. Very reassuring.
Posts.Title: Mama gram after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Wendloui Hi justlittleme I've already started Tamoxifen and so far doing ok but my ocologist has also asked me about zoladex and her reasoning about the injections were if you have too many effects from the lack of eostrogen the injections are reversible, ovary removal isn't, i'm back on the 15th feb to discuss a start date then if all goes well i'll consider a oopherectomy later, i personally don't want to have any more surgery just yet, still trying to recover from the 3 i had last year That's a very good point Wendy. Thank you. Injections being reversible is a definite consideration. I guess if my body copes with injections for a while first, it would cope with ovaries being removed?  Thank you for this insight.
Posts.Title: Injection or removal of ovaries?

Posts.Content: I'm going to discuss this at my next oncology appointment too.  I'm having limited side effects on Zolodex and tamoxifen though do don't know whether to rock the boat. I too had diep and find the monthly injections extremely painful as I have no fat left to inject into...maybe it's my nurse, as pp said hers were painless.
Posts.Title: Injection or removal of ovaries?

Posts.Content: Been told I need tamoxifen for at least ten years. But also need to 'turn off ' my ovaries. This is apparently done by a three monthly injection or by removing the ovaries. Which did you choose and why? I'm leaning towards removal, but worried about laparoscopic surgery after diep as belly button looks so rough at the moment!
Posts.Title: Injection or removal of ovaries?

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy full lymph clearance and diep reconstruction last Wednesday. Hopefully home tomorrow. Pain was my biggest worry. Best advice is keep talking to the nurses. They have seen it all and there are some great drugs. My diep was more sore than the boob so you won't have that. Walk as much as you can when you feel able. I do laps of ward!  And keep positive. Your cancer is being taken away. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: I had three but for fertility reasons not cancer. One under general and two without. Uncomfortable , but manageable I'd say.
Posts.Title: hysteroscopy
